intro: Dryandra baxteri, commonly known as the Baxter's dryandra, is a species of shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, showcasing drought resistance through its succulent stems and reduced leaf surface area. It plays a significant role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically valuable species.
